attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent, I oppose these fee increases specifically for all adoption
filings for the following reasons:

1. Our West Palm Beach, Florida office is so slow in processing I-600A (they are
proud to announce that it only takes 4 months), that we have to call our local
representatives to get our I-171H processed within the 4-month timeframe. This
timeframe is unacceptable for the hundreds of dollars already being paid and
partciularly unacceptable with a fee increase!

2. Child matches from China are taking longer and longer and I-171H's are
expiring before adoptive families are approved to travel; therefore, they have to
refile a new I600-A for the same adoption incurring the same costs a second time.

3. An I-171H is only good for 18 months and the USCIS will not allow it to be
renewed. Adoptive families have to file a new I-600A and pay the fee again for an I-
171H that was already approved.

Thank you for allowing me to voice my opposition to this fee increase.

Sincerely,
Laura L. Allianic
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Laura Allianic
